definition: seven mortal forms in Daoism, representing carnal life and desires/contrasted with 三魂 three immortal souls
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body
three immortal souls and seven mortal forms in Daoism, contrasting the spiritual and carnal side of man
three immortal souls in Daoism, representing spirit and intellect

soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body
soul/spirit/immortal soul, i.e. that can be detached from the body

seven emotional states/seven affects of traditional Chinese medical theory and therapy, namely: joy 喜[xi3], anger 怒[nu4], anxiety 憂|忧[you1], thought 思[si1], grief 悲[bei1], fear 恐[kong3], fright 驚|惊[jing1]/seven relations
body and soul/physical and spiritual/material form and internal spirit
